H0.text: Magnify the work is the action students must take by wearing goggles while using hammers to break apart rocks as part of an investigation.

H1.text: Keep hair out of their faces is why students must wear goggles when using hammers to break apart rocks as part of an investigation.

H2.text: Protecting their eyes from debris is why students must wear goggles when they use hammers to break apart rocks as part of an investigation.

H3.text: Prevent glare from the light is the reason students must wear goggles while using hammers to break apart rocks as part of an investigation.

A4.text: Debris such as dust, dirt, and small rocks can be picked up by the wind and fly into one's eyes. This can cause discomfort and potentially lead to a corneal abrasion or infection.

A5.text: Examples of risks requiring eye protection can include: impact from particles or debris, light or radiation, wind blast, heat, sea spray or impact from some type of ball or puck used in sports.
